round to maintain the griddle stitch pattern r18 chain 3 skip first 11 then double_crochet 1 in the 12th st this creates the thumb hole single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around 37 r19 in blo of 3 chain sts double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in both loops now single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around 37 r20-24 single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around 37 alternate which stitch you start with each round to maintain the griddle stitch pattern slip_stitch in next st fasten_off and weave in ends thumb join your yarn to the 1st stitch of r17 of the mitt at the opening of the thumb hole r18 thumb single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 in first 11 sts then double_crochet 1 into the side of the mitt before the chain sts to add one more stitch in flo of the 3 chain sts single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 15 r19 thumb double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 around 15 r20 thumb single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 around 15 slip_stitch in next st fasten_off sew up any gaps where the thumb meets the rest of the mitt weave in ends 3 griddle stitch mitts project notes this pattern is easily adjustable by changing yarn and hook size or by adjusting the length of each piece you can work more row on the cuff as needed for your wrist size if you add row to the cuff adjust the the mitt accordingly it should always be an odd number of stitches so if you worked an odd number of row for the cuff work the same number of stitches for your starting round of the mitt if you worked an even number of row for the cuff add 1 to the number of row and work that many stitches for your starting round of the mitt if you need a longer mitt you can add more row to the mitt and thumb pieces just remember to maintain the griddle stitch pattern throughout by alternating which stitch you start with on each round if you need a larger thumb hole you can add more increases to rounds 9 and 10 or wherever theyʼre most comfortable by working both a single_crochet and double_crochet in the same stitch for each increase work an even number of increases to maintain the griddle stitch pattern use the griddle stitch pattern to decide whether you should do a single_crochet or double_crochet first for your increases when in doubt know that you should always be working a single_crochet into each double_crochet of the previous round and working a double_crochet into each single_crochet of
